Hinata and other Hyuga Clan members may still be involved because of Hanabi, should you want their help. Toneri is a very strong opponent after all. Help will likely be needed (choosing this Scenario won’t impact Hinata and Naruto’s relationship unless you purposely interfere)

Rewards:
You receive the Tenseigan and the Tenseigan – Energy Vessel for free along with Toneri’s Castle, complete with the puppet army that manned it.

options.label: One Eyed God Jumper
options.description:
Ten-Tails. Daidarabotchi. The Jūbi. Datara. The God Tree. The greatest power this world has seen, now split apart into nine fragments, Tailed Beasts that, while impressive, are nevertheless a sum lesser than its original whole. You must claim this power for yourself, and become a god made manifest in this world.

This Scenario’s objective is deceptively simple, despite its inherent difficulty. You must become the Jinchūriki of the Ten Tails. Yes, you still have to do this if you’re starting the Jump as a Jūbi Jinchūriki. There’s more than one Ten Tails, after all. To accomplish your goal, you must track down each of the nine Tailed Beasts, extract them from their current Jinchūriki, and seal them within yourself. In truth, you do not need to take the Beasts in their entirety, merely extracting a significant portion of their being would be sufficient. Naturally, this will not be an easy task to complete. The Jinchūriki of the Tailed Beasts are granted considerable power by their passengers, and while they may be feared and reviled by their villages, even the most spiteful nations recognizes their strategic value and will fight to keep them from your hands. At the end of the Jump, the original Tailed Beasts are released if you wish.

Upon subsuming all nine Tailed Beasts, they will merge and become the Ten Tails within you, granting you the immense power deserving of its Jinchūriki.

Rewards:
First, despite being the Jinchūriki of the Ten-Tails rather than all nine individual Tailed Beasts, you gain access to their forms and their abilities.

Secondly, you are able to project the Tailed Beasts out into the world, losing access to their chakra while they are separate from you. You may decide whether or not these Tailed Beasts retain the personalities of the originals. They are loyal to you either way.

Thirdly, you can turn others into a temporary Jinchūriki of sorts for any of your Tailed Beasts with but a touch. While your Tailed Beast dwells within someone else, you cannot harness the powers inherent to them until they are part of you once more. You may recover any distributed Tailed Beasts with a thought, regardless of distance. Taking back the power of the Tailed Beasts from temporary Jinchūriki will not kill them.

Finally, your Rinnegan will evolve into a Rinne Sharingan.

options.label: The Curse of Hatred & The Will of Fire
options.description:
Throughout the ages, the children of the Sage of Six Paths, Indra and Asura, have reincarnated time and time again, with each incarnation coming into conflict over the ideal path to peace. But it seems the Sage had a third child, one whose most recent reincarnation… is you. Much like Indra and Asura, who believed the path to peace lay in power and love respectively, your ancestor had a philosophy of their own. Perhaps it was the same as one brother or the other, or perhaps it was an alternate road to peace. Regardless of the path you choose, whether it be Indra’s philosophy of reaching peace through power, Asura’s philosophy of doing so through love, or a path of your own choosing, you will clash with your fellow reincarnates, whose identities may vary depending on the Drawbacks you have taken, and must strive to reshape the shinobi world according to your inherited philosophy.

To clear this Scenario, you must achieve world peace. This peace must last at least ten years. There can still be incidental violence, ranging from petty crimes to the odd terrorist movement, but the nations and their general populace must be at peace and content with that peace. If you have not reached the start of the era of peace by the end of ten years, you may continue striving towards achieving it, for up to a century past the normal end of the Jump without Drawbacks.

If the ten years of peace would take you beyond that limit, you may stay until you die, the era ends, or you reach a full ten years of peace. Should the peace end before those ten years are up, the Jump ends, and you fail the Scenario. Should you die outside the bounds you have set for your Jump while the era of peace is ongoing but has not yet reached a full ten years, time will continue in the Jump. If the peace lasts beyond your death for the remainder of the ten-year requirement, the Scenario is still considered cleared. It is a powerful thing to create a peace that will last beyond your own era, after all.

Rewards:
For achieving such a tremendous and monumental goal, your rewards will be great indeed.

Firstly, you now have both the Six Paths Yin Power and the Six Paths Yang Power, symbolized by a sun and moon on the palm of your hands. You may conceal them if you wish. Individually, the Yang Power uses physical energy to control vitality, allowing the user to perform absurd acts of healing with a mere touch. Meanwhile, the Yin Power uses spiritual energy to control imagination, projecting ideas into physical forms. By infusing the Six Paths Power into your techniques, you can elevate them to greater heights, such as transforming Amaterasu into Hinokagutsuchi or turning a Rasengan into an Amenomihashira. But what they can do alone pales in comparison to the two Powers working in harmony.

Combined, these powers allow you to perform the Six Paths – Chibaku Tensei by touching the target with both hands. This ultimate sealing technique will trap the target inside a moon-sized mass of stone and dirt and launches them into orbit. The only way the victim of this technique will be able to escape is if they are summoned out of the moon, either by the user or someone with their powers.

But that is only part of what you could do. Using the Six Paths Power, you will be able to perform the Sage of Six Paths’ most vaunted technique, the Creation of All Things. This almighty technique allows the user to turn their ideas into reality and to create life by using Yin Chakra to give ideas physical form and then use Yang Chakra to breathe vitality into those forms. Initially, this will be very taxing to perform but, as in all things, practice and training will make it easier.

Finally, there is one more boon you receive. Prior to entering a new Jump, you may choose to designate yourself the reincarnation of a deceased individual from the setting. This doesn’t necessarily grant you any extra powers beyond a natural affinity for some of the things they could do that were teachable, but it gives you memories stretching back dozens of generations and it can grant you some measure of influence in certain circles. Naturally, you can only be a reincarnation of someone who has already died by the time you enter the Jump in question

options.label: Return to the Village
options.description: So you’re done with the adventures throughout this world? I hope that you find peace after all the years of war and conflict, and, most of all, I hope you had fun!

options.label: The Infinite Dream
options.description: So you’d like to stay in the world you’ve helped to shape? To help make the stay even better take an extra 1000 CP to spend on anything else you’d like to gather for your stay

options.label: The Adventure Continues
options.description: So you plan to continue on, chasing your own Nindō? I hope you remember these years fondly and continue following your own path!

subcategories.name: Jinchūriki
subcategories.text:
For Tailed Beasts, you can choose whether you not have the original. For example, if you pick Kurama, the Jumper can choose for Kurama to be ripped out of Naruto and implanted into you. For free, you can decide for everyone in Konoha to see it happen. Also, don’t worry about them, the benefactor will make sure they won't die unless you want them to e.g. if you pick Jūbi you can decide which ones live. However, for those who want the canon characters to remain Jinchūriki they can choose for copies of the Tailed Beasts to be created and implanted into you.

For the Jūbi Jinchūriki, you can choose for your benefactor to have created a Jūbi for you and implanted it inside you. Or you can have your benefactor rip out all the Tailed Beasts in canon instead but be warned that this will affect canon.

subcategories.name: Jinchūriki Transformations
subcategories.text:
This is done by a Jinchūriki tapping into their Tailed Beast’s power. There are two levels to this transformation. When the first level is activated, the user is surrounded by a layer of red chakra that forms a red tail behind the user, increasing the user’s strength and speed, healing the user and allowing the user to manipulate the Tailed Beast’s chakra. The number of tails formed signifies how much of the Tailed Beast’s chakra the user is drawing out. In this state, the body of the user changes slightly. For example, Naruto has his eyes change color, his pupils turn into slits and his nails and teeth elongate, becoming more fox-like in nature.

In the second state, the user’s body changes massively, becoming enveloped entirely with red chakra and taking on a form that becomes closer to the beast within as more and more tails are drawn out.

subcategories.name: Partial Transformations
subcategories.text: Another transformation that a Jinchūriki can access is a partial transformation into their Tailed Beast. As it says, this is partial meaning that only parts of the Jinchūriki are transformed, e.g. one who has the eight tails can produce extra tentacles from their body, or that their entire body has been transformed but they have not yet taken on the form of the Tailed Beast. Either way, barring Shukaku’s Jinchūriki, the transformations are composed of chakra.

subcategories.name: Tailed Beast Mode
subcategories.text: This form allows the Jinchūriki to transform into their Tailed Beast while retaining absolute control over themselves and with total access to the Tailed Beast’s full strength and abilities. The Jinchūriki can also pass control over to the beast itself.

subcategories.name: Nine Tails Chakra Mode
subcategories.text: Now, this form is different and can only be unlocked by those who have earned the friendship of the Nine Tails. Like all Jinchūriki transformations, this mode enhances the user’s physical abilities, bestowing enough strength to one-shot weak opponents like White Zetsu, speed to rival and surpass the likes of the Fourth Raikage, and durability to withstand attacks from the Jūbi. Additional abilities include the ability to form extra arms with chakra and the ability to sense negative emotions (if you opted to become the Nine-Tails itself, then you have access to the last ability outside of the chakra mode too).

subcategories.name: Baryon Mode
subcategories.text: Another transformation unique to Nine Tails and its Jinchūriki. In a process similar to nuclear fusion, the beast and Jinchūriki’s chakra collide together and consumed to create a new type of energy. The resulting power boost is enough to surpass the physical abilities of a high-class Ōtsutsuki and gives the ability to drain an enemy’s lifespan on contact. This comes at a great cost however as the mode is extremely unstable, not allowing for any unnecessary movements lest the Jinchūriki risk being drained of their own lifespan and the Tailed Beast’s being even more endangered since as a being made of chakra, powering the transformations sucks at its very existence (If you opted to become the Nine Tails, you can still use this mode alone, but remember now that you endanger your life directly).
